item.title: Report E-2024110230
item.description:
Report E-2024110230

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-15T12:23:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-12
  • City: DERWOOD
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XLM experienced a customer location release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to site to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 20-gallons of product released to a 4’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor and a 25’ x 15’ area of the asphalt lot below. The drum appeared to be crushed or punctured by the pallet, causing the release. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents and vinegar were deployed to clean and neutralize the impacted areas. All impacted absorbents and debris were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was transported to XPO for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024110233
item.description:
Report E-2024110233

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-15T12:23:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-12
  • City: GRAND RAPIDS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XGR experienced a UN2014 Hydrogen Peroxide 30% release from a box containing a 32-ounce poly bottle. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 6-ounces of product released to the cardboard and plastic packaging only due to the container being crushed and damaging the lid. The damaged bottle was placed into a 55-gallon vented poly drum. The impacted carboard, plastic, pads, and PPE were placed into a second 55-gallon poly drum and submerged in water. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On November 5, 2024, oen (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3266 was damaged in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and soda ash to remediate the UN3266-impacted impacted dock floor. The damaged pail and all impacted debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 35-gallon lined poly drums for disposal.

  • Description: 1. X-2024110520 SUPERVISOR CALLED IN A LEAKER TO THE DMP AND DMP DISPATCHED A RESPONDER WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART. RESPONDER ARRIVED ON SCENE AND FOUND THE LEAKING PACKAGE. RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE DECSION TREE GUIDLINES AND WENT TO RESPONSE SHEET SEVEN. RESPONDER FOLLOWED CLEAN UP PROCEDURE AND BROUGHT THE LEAKER BACK TO THE DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL. PACKAGE WAS PROPERLY DISPOSED OF. 2. X-2024110521 LEAKER WAS CALLED INTO THE DMP AND DMP DISPATCHED A RESPONDER WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART TO DOOR 22. RESPONDER ARRIVED ON SCENE AND FOUND THE LEAKER AND USED THE DECSION TREE TO FIND CORRECT RESPONSE SHEET. RESPONDER USED THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL AND BRING BACK THE LEAKER TO DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL. LEAKER WAS PROPERLY DISPOSED OF.

  • City: KANSAS CITY

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 15:17 PM ET, XKC contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred inside of a trailer located at a customer's location, Par Electric, at 2101 Manchester Trafficway, Kansas City, MO. The spill consists of approximately 1 gallon of Aqua Balance Muriatic Acid, which released from 1 or more 1-gallon plastic jug due to other freight crushing the box containing the jugs during transit, impacting the box and the trailer floor. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 cup from 1-gallon plastic jog of Aqua Balance Muriatic Acid product released to 1’x1' area of the trailer floor and cardboard due to improper loading / load shift. The contractors overpacked the product to (1) 5-gallon metal drum and neutralized debris, cardboard, absorbents and PPE to (1) 35-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: At 11:21 AM ET, ULA contacted the call center to report a spill that was found on the dock in Santa Fe Springs, CA. The spill consists of approximately 10 ounces of Potassium Chlorate, which released from 2–50-pound paper bags due to the pallet containing a total of 40-to-50-pound paper bags of the same property found tipped over. The terminal stated they will have to restack the pallet and there could potentially be other bags that are leaking. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-ounces from 3-damaged bags of product released to trailer floor and adjacent product due to improper loading. The contractors overpacked bags of product, plastic shrink-wrap, PPE, and floor debris submerged in water to (2) 15-gallon metal drums and (1) 5-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:
Report E-2024110252

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-15T12:23:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-09
  • City: ANDREWS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PETROLEUM TRANSPORTS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Driver allowed CTMV to drift onto the right shoulder of the roadway. The driver over corrected to the left, which caused the CTMV to roll onto its right side. This caused about a 2 to 3 foot cut into the tank. Approximately 3,500 gallons of unleaded gasoline spilled onto the shoulder of the roadway. The Texas Department of Public Safety responded to the scene and notified United Petroleum Transports, Inc. UPT then contracted an Environmental Clean up Service. The Environmental Clean up Service went the scene and contained the spill. It the went through the process of removing the contaminated soil and replacing it with clean soil. The final remediation was done on 11/11/2024 and report was sent to TXDEQ. Fortunately, the spill occurred in an unpopulated area so no people, homes, or business were affected.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XNA experienced a UN1760 Biotrend Eco-Clear release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10 ounces of product released to a 6” x 6” area of the dock and poly containment pallet. The release was due to improper loading; however, the damage was not visible. The product was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one for shipment on. Vinegar was then used along with absorbents to clean the impacted pallet and dock. The damaged tote was cut up and containerized along with absorbents and pads into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: EARTH CITY

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A FULLY LABELED HAZMAT PACKAGE THAT APPEARED TO BE LEAKING WAS DISCOVERED BY THE PICKOFF ON THE PD 11. THE PICKOFF STOPPED THE BELT, LOCKED IT, TESTED IT, LEFT THE AREA, AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. WITHIN 4 MINUTES A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED DONNING THE CORRECT PPE WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. USING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE PACKAGE COULD BE SAFELY TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION IT WAS REVEALED THAT THE LID ON THE INNER 5 GALLON PLASIC CONTAINER HAD A SMALL PERFORATION IN THE CENTER THAT HAD ALLOWED 4 OUNCES OF LIQUID TO LEAK OUT ONTO THE OUTER CONTAINER.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 29, 2024, three (3) 50-pound bags of UN3378 were torn in transit and released approximately one (1) pound of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews down stacked the pallet and collected three (3) 50-pound damaged bags. GES then utilized hand tools to collect the spent product off of the trailer floor. All spent product and damaged bags were collected and containerized into one (1) 30-gallon drum for terminal disposal.

  • Description: EnviroServe was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 8ft-by-50ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that fifty-five (55) gallons of material was released due to a defective metal drum. EnviroServe personnel used hand tools and absorbent rags to removed the solidified material. The recovered material was containerized into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum and the defective drum was overpacked into one (1) 85-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the J.B. Hunt terminal pending profile approval.

  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted an 8ft-by-15ft area of the trailer floor and concrete terminal floor and estimated that two (2) gallons of material was released due to the battery overturning during transit. Clean Harbors personnel deployed a neutralizer to the impacted area and then used a granular absorbent to recover the spent material. The spent absorbents were containerized into six (6) 55-gallon poly drums. The generated waste were transported to a nearby ESTES terminal. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110171
item.description:
Report E-2024110171

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-14T12:23:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-16
  • City: BOSTON
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 16, 2024, at Eli Lilly's Boston facility, Veolia employees were in the process of loading drums onto a truck when they detected a solvent odor. Initially, they attributed the smell to recently filled drums. However, upon relocating the vehicle, they discovered a pinhole leak in the top of one drum, just below the upper chime. The affected container was a 55-gallon plastic drum, and it is believed that the puncture occurred during its removal from the storage location. Upon discovering the leak, employees promptly reported the incident and transferred the leaking drum into an 851A2 salvage drum to ensure safe transportation to the final disposal facility. Approximately one pint of halogenated solvent waste escaped from the drum. The spill was quickly contained using spill pads and absorbent materials. The leaking drum, along with the cleanup materials, was then placed into an appropriate salvage drum. Given the small size of the hole and the rapid response of the team, the release is estimated to have lasted about 10 minutes. The drum was still largely full when the leak was detected, and the quantity released did not exceed the reportable quantity (RQ) threshold.

item.description:
Report E-2024110193

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-13T12:22:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-08
  • City: WAITE PARK
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XBD experienced a UN3352 Lambda-Cyhalothrin 1 EC release from a box containing (4) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of product released to a 2’ x 2’ area of the trailer floor. The box was damaged due to improper loading, appearing to have been hit by another pallet or forklift. A total of (8) 1-gallon poly jugs of product were found impacted and placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. The impacted absorbents, cardboard, PPE, and cleanup debris were placed into a second 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 1, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN3149 were punctured in transit and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement below. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer and pavement and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged containers of product were placed into two (2) 5-gallon containers and staged on the trailer to be taken back to the terminal as product.

  • Description: At 06:09 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO (LSL) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to a forklift puncture, approximately 2 gallons of Carboline Rust Bond FC Part A (hazardous - UN1263) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the boxes and a little on the dock floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product, 2 damaged cans, and oil-dri will be placed into a 5-gallon metal drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

item.title: Report E-2024110199
item.description:
Report E-2024110199

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-13T12:22:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-12
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 04:23 EST XPO-XHG contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 15 gallons of Acetone ACS Grade from a 55-gallon metal drum, impacting the dock and trailer floor due to forklift puncture. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 12 gallons of Acetone ACS Grade product released from (1) 55-gallon metal drum to a 10’x4’ area impacting concrete dock floor and concrete beneath trailer due to being tote being punctured by forklift. The product and 55-gallon metal drum were overpacked into (1) 85-gallon metal drum, acetone impacted granular absorbents and pallet pieces were containerized to (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to pick up.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 21:59 ET on 10/11, XPO-XCF contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 1 ounce of "FT-100 Concentrate" from a 275-gallon poly tote impacting only the top face of the container. The tote has a loose cap as a packaging error by the shipper. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2 ounces of FT-100 Concentrate product released from the cap of the 275-gallon poly tote due to being loose - improper packaging. The contractors tightened the cap and containerized the impacted absorbent pads and PPE into (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 8:32 AM ET, XCD contacted the call center to request help with a spill that occurred inside of a trailer in Cadillac, MI. The spill consists of approximately 100 gallons of AB-100, which was released from 1 275-gallon plastic tote due to a forklift puncture. Contractors neutralized 110' area with KolorSafe, cut up tote and cleaned impacted pallets were swapped for new ones. Impacted and neutralized absorbents were placed into (8) 55-gallon metal drums, cut up tote pieces were containerized in (2) 55-gallon metal drums, cubic yard box was used to contain neutralized and impacted pallet pieces. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
